intro: Lepidosperma scabrum var. effusum, commonly known as the soft-leaved sedgeland sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in wet or seasonally wet environments, such as marshes and swampy areas. This variant is distinguished by its softer, more loosely textured foliage compared to other varieties of Lepidosperma.
